messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: bird kantei, another opening act for Jim's kantei coming up.
messages.msgSnippet: I agree with the other comments on your hawk guard.  Nagoya-mono at best. Now introducing, kantei #4... Jim, I can hear boo-ing ......this Purple Haze is
messages.messageBody:
I agree with the other comments on your hawk guard. Nagoya-mono at best.

Now introducing, kantei #4...


Jim,
I can hear boo-ing ......this Purple Haze is dissipating fast........
please hurry up with the main act, BRING ON THE MONKEES !!
p.s. no more front role seats for you three.........
milt

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: bird kantei, another opening act for Jim's kantei coming up.
messages.msgSnippet: Since you asked Milt- I am beginning to think you post these just to piss us all off. Alan hit the nail on the head; the subject and presentation are
messages.messageBody:
Since you asked Milt-
I am beginning to think you post these just to piss us all off. Alan
hit the nail on the head; the subject and presentation are
interesting, a lot more style and activity than staid Goto work BUT
it looks like the whole thing was carved from crayon and melted
together.
I don't know jack about kodogu but I clearly remember the lesson "a
master takes the time to cut every last feather/hair, the proportions
are perfect and in comparison it is clearly the work of a master" not
the case here I am afraid...
-t

messages.messageBody:
Milt, Barry,
It looks fairly modern, the bird is poorly chiselled.
Alan

----- Original Message -----
From: Barry Thomas
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 09, 2006 11:04 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] bird kantei, another opening act for Jim's kantei coming up.


Ideas??? Crook piccies, but I'll try... Too good to be machibori, but not good
enough otherwise = Meiji crapper??

Barry Thomas.

----- Original Message -----
From: "bungotakadasword" <MuramasaIII@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, April 09, 2006 3:05 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] bird kantei, another opening act for Jim's kantei coming
up.


http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/photos/view/ca42?b=6

more pics in the folder......

the bird is about 0.65 cm " tall " above the flat nanako ground.

Doesn't feel/look like the usual late edo Yokohama special to
me.............

ideas ?


milt
